text: Oudehaske () is a village in De Fryske Marren in the province of Friesland, the Netherlands. It had a population of around 1980 in 2017.Kerncijfers wijken en buurten 2017 - CBS ==History== Before 2014, Oudehaske was part of the Skarsterlân municipality and before 1984 it was part of Haskerland. Oudehaske is known in traffic engineering circles for the radical innovation in street design pioneered there by Hans Monderman, removing signs and using subtle cues to indicate that the roadways are shared space between pedestrians and other vehicles. ==References== ==External links== Category:De Fryske Marren Category:Populated places in Friesland
title: Oudehaske
